intro: Corydalis turtschaninovii f. haitaoensis, commonly known as the Haitao Corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Native to the mountainous regions of China, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticultural collections.
